TEXT: The applicant is a NORP citizen of NORP origin , born in DATE and living in GPE . He is represented by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .

On DATE the applicant was issued with a penal order ( Strafbefehl ) by ORG ( ORG ) for having entered the territory of GPE illegally , i.e. without a visa . The applicant was fined DATE rates in the amount of CARDINAL ORG each .

Upon the applicant ’s objection ( PERSON ) , trial proceedings were instituted before ORG . In these and the following proceedings , the applicant was represented by his defence counsel , PERSON . At a hearing before FAC on DATE , the applicant 's counsel declared that asylum proceedings were pending . The court decided to adjourn the case sine die .
On DATE , in the resumed proceedings , ORG convicted the applicant of having illegally entered GPE . The applicant was sentenced to a fine of DATE rates in the amount of CARDINAL DM each .
On DATE ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) , upon the applicant ’s appeal on points of law ( Revision ) , quashed the judgment of CARDINAL DATE and sent the case back for a new trial .

On DATE ORG acquitted the applicant , who had in the meantime been recognised as a refugee , and imposed the costs of the proceedings on the ORG . ORG decided furthermore that it would deal with the applicant ’s claim for compensation under LAW ( PERSON über die PERSON für GPE ) in separate proceedings . The judgment was served on the applicant on DATE .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s compensation claim .

On DATE the ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal . It found that LAW provided compensation only and exclusively for damages resulting from conviction or other criminal prosecution measures enumerated in LAW . Compensation in respect of an excessive length of criminal proceedings was not comprised . Neither did the ORG provide for such a right . Moreover , the conditions for claiming compensation of the applicant ’s provisional arrest were not met .
The applicant then lodged a constitutional complaint ( ORG ) , which was rejected by a group of CARDINAL judges of ORG on DATE .
